*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Mary Austin Holley, December 25, 1831. Suggesting publications concerning Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="12-25-1831">December 25, 1831*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Dear *person_mentioned*Cousin*/person_mentioned*, */p* *p*I am glad of the excuse afforded by the inclosed to say farewell once more. I beg you to take especial care to go no where but to the *location_mentioned*post office*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I think you can benefit your *location_mentioned*adopted Country*/location_mentioned* by your correspondence with your numerous *person_mentioned*acquaintance*/person_mentioned*. Credit, you know, is all important to a young and new *location_mentioned*house*/location_mentioned*. The erroneous impression that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*is settled by bad *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*must be totally done away with. I need not remind you that what is said in *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* soon flies through the *location_mentioned*South*/location_mentioned*. It would be a good plan to have the printed copy of the Colonization law published with the translated copy and both will be perpetuated, and can be compared side, by side.*/p*
*p*May you have a safe and pleasant voyage. The *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1832">next year*/date_mentioned*—how much happiness—or how much bitter disappointment—it may bring—, for I hope then we shall all be quietly and happily settled.*/p* *p*Farewell—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S F A*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
